column1: The Hôtel Hermitage Monte-Carlo is a palace style Belle Époque in the heart of Monaco on the French Riviera . It belongs to the Société des bains de mer de Monaco. It was built in 1890 and 1896 the architect Nicolas Marquet with the participation of Gustave Eiffel. == Location

== The Hotel Hermitage Monte-Carlo is overlooking the Monaco Harbor and the Mediterranean Sea. It is classified as Monument.It is part of the elite palaces in Monaco with the Hôtel de Paris Monte-Carlo, the Monte-Carlo Beach and Monte-Carlo Bay Hotel & Resort. The lobby was designed by Gustave Eiffel.
